s: So whats the point of this. ... The short answer to this, as with nearly all questions about Amazon’s dubious practices, is “to make more money”. If you are yourself losing sales as a result, rest assured they are getting those sales (and associated fees) from someone else.

t: In-Depth Study of All 92 Amazon Private Label Brands
s: Amazon stated in 2019 that they have 158,000 private brand products across 45 brands. However, The Wall Street Journal reported in 2023 that dozens of brands were being phased out, leaving Amazon with fewer than 20 house brands, particularly in apparel and furniture.

t: Secret Amazon Brands Are Quietly Taking Over Amazon.com - Slashdot
s: Small Parts. You might not know it from their names, but these brands all belong to Amazon. Amazon's private label business is booming, on pace to generate $7.5 billion this year and $25 billion by 2022, according to estimates from investment firm SunTrust Robinson Humphrey.
